channel.title: BBC News - England
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Abuse leaves hospitality staff at 'breaking point'
item.description: Staff say they are upset and feel demoralised by rude customers during a busy summer season.

item.title: The pregnant woman who caught a serial voyeur masseur
item.description: How a suspicious-looking alarm clock led to the downfall of a masseur who was spying on his clients.

item.title: Bournemouth boy, 13, dies of suspected drug overdose
item.description: A 14-year-old boy has been arrested after Mehmet Altun, 13, became ill in Bournemouth and died.

item.title: Graffiti to ward off evil found at Kibworth Harcourt mill
item.description: The marks have been found at the Leicestershire mill, which dates from at least 1711.

item.title: Leeds Leodis archive seeks help over old photos
item.description: The Leodis archive wants help to identify people or places in several mystery pictures of Leeds.

item.title: Streatham terror attack: Prison recall might have stopped Sudesh Amman
item.description: Sudesh Amman could have been stopped from stabbing two people in south London, an inquest finds.

item.title: Netflix production 'boom' benefits TV graduates
item.description: Despite production stalling because of coronavirus last year, a studio says it's never been so busy.

item.title: Gun returned to Plymouth attacker after rehabilitation scheme
item.description: A shotgun and certificate were returned to Jake Davison in July after a police review.

item.title: Sheffield hotel fall: MPs call for urgent investigation after death
item.description: They are backing a review into refugee safety after Mohammed Munib Majeedi fell from a hotel window.

item.title: Woman reverses own car off truck to foil Wolverhampton theft
item.description: She saves her vehicle from a transporter's ramp shortly after leaving a slimming club at a church.

item.title: Heron put down after flying with crossbow bolt in Suffolk
item.description: It had been seen flying for weeks before RSPCA officers rescued the "very thin, weak" bird.

item.title: Covid-19: Statues recognise NHS staff and key workers
item.description: Each of the 51 statues on display in Birmingham has been decorated by a different artist.

item.title: Injured Dubai cat flown to Bradford rescue centre
item.description: The cat was ‘left for dead’ until the centre paid for the transport to West Yorkshire.

item.title: The West End star who worked as carer during lockdown
item.description: As theatres reopen, actors like Stephen Beckett have been swapping their lockdown jobs for their place on the stage once more.

item.title: 'I thought I can make a difference'
item.description: A Hull hairdresser who lost his own hair due to cancer is now making wigs to help others.

item.title: Cumbria kidney swap couple recovering after surgery
item.description: The couple joined a national kidney sharing scheme to boost Fiona's chances of finding a donor.

item.title: Plasma donor meets children helped by donations
item.description: A donor from Coventry meets a family from Nottingham whose children who were saved by plasma.

item.title: Peterborough mum back at home with baby born before Covid coma
item.description: Hajrah Aslam described being back at home with her baby as a "dream come true".

item.title: Army supporting ambulance services in England
item.description: High demand and staffing shortages have meant the Army has been called in to help look after patients.

item.title: Red phone box dug up and stolen from village garden
item.description: Three men used a digger to steal the phone box, belonging to Chelford Parish Council, police say.

item.title: Geronimo the alpaca legal fight cost £43k plus lost income
item.description: Helen Macdonald says apart from legal costs her farm has been deprived of income for four years.

item.title: Northampton: Conservative donor admits £10k disguised contribution
item.description: Alan Mayfield gave the sum to a Conservative group but did not declare he was not the funds' source.

item.title: London Underground: Union calls off two strikes
item.description: Workers were due to hold two 24-hour strikes in a dispute over night tube rotas.

item.title: Poretti-Boltshauser syndrome diagnosis for Wallsend girl
item.description: Addison Black, five, is diagnosed with Poretti-Boltshauser syndrome by university experts.

item.title: Storm Christoph: Weaverham flood-hit residents angry
item.description: Residents in a Cheshire village whose homes were flooded in January are still unable to return home.

item.title: Northumbria Police officer groomed vulnerable single mothers
item.description: Erling Leask is sentenced for grooming two vulnerable single mothers while working as a PC.

item.title: Students 'devastated' after losing Leeds college places
item.description: Notre Dame College in Leeds is criticised for telling pupils by text the night before enrolment.

item.title: The Hundred: Southern Brave thrash Trent Rockets to reach Lord's final
item.description: Southern Brave thrash Trent Rockets by seven wickets in the men's Hundred eliminator to set up a final against Birmingham Phoenix.

item.title: Swansea overcome Bristol City for Martin's first win
item.description: Swansea City earn a first Championship win under new head coach Russell Martin as they beat Bristol City in a heated encounter at Ashton Gate.

item.title: Super League: Wigan Warriors 2-26 St Helens - Saints coast to highly charged derby win
item.description: St Helens coast to a derby win over Wigan Warriors in a highly charged Super League fixture at the DW Stadium.

item.title: 'I'm loving every minute of it' - Phoenix teenager Smeed on reaching Hundred final
item.description: Birmingham Phoenix's Will Smeed, the youngest player in the men's Hundred, tells BBC Points West about his rise into the limelight.

item.title: Arsenal sign Martin Odegaard from Real Madrid and Sheffield United's Aaron Ramsdale
item.description: Arsenal complete deals for Real Madrid midfielder Martin Odegaard and Sheffield United goalkeeper Aaron Ramsdale.
